//: DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE before reading the comments below:
Default configuration for Tiny Tapeout projects. It fits most designs.
Change only if you know what you're doing. Timing/area failures may result otherwise.
If you get stuck, open an issue or ask on Discord.
Placement density. If Global Placement fails (GPL-0302), try raising to 65–80.
Clock period in ns (20 ns = 50 MHz). If you see setup violations, increase to 25–40.
Linter settings (keeping it ON is recommended).
Clock port name in your top. Your wrapper uses 'clk'.
LibreLane configuration reference: https://librelane.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/configuration.html
!!! DO NOT CHANGE ANYTHING BELOW THIS POINT !!!
Save time (XOR/DRC are run in CI elsewhere).
Don't buffer output ports' clocks.
Margins — small left/right margins help dense I/O rows on TT.
Absolute die sizing (TT tiles define size).
Allow some congestion in global routing (helps larger designs).
PDN pitch tuned for TT; usually leave as-is.
Clock tree synthesis ON.
No power rings (TT style).
Avoid DEF labels to prevent LVS issues.
Export LEF with pins only.
